body_html:
Hi @andrewssobral , I have changed 'SpatialUpSamplingBilinear.cu' on my TX2 as you mentioned(https://gist.github.com/andrewssobral/42ccdd84b65b55f5b8b47ad30e9c82d5) and re-compiled PyTorch ('sudo python setup.py install' at Pytorch directory).
But it also showed the error:
RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (7) : too many resources requested for launch at /home/nvidia/pytorch/torch/lib/THCUNN/generic/SpatialUpSamplingBilinear.cu:66
How can I fix it? Is it need any c compile process to build setup.py?
Please give me a advice.

body:
Hi @andrewssobral , I have changed 'SpatialUpSamplingBilinear.cu' on my TX2 as you mentioned(https://gist.github.com/andrewssobral/42ccdd84b65b55f5b8b47ad30e9c82d5) and re-compiled PyTorch ('sudo python setup.py install' at Pytorch directory). 
But it also showed the error: 
RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (7) : too many resources requested for launch at /home/nvidia/pytorch/torch/lib/THCUNN/generic/SpatialUpSamplingBilinear.cu:66
How can I fix it? Is it need any c compile process to build setup.py?
Please give me a advice.
